projects.title: Translational Research
projects.description: Under Dr. Ronald Falk at the UNC Kidney Center, I conducted bench research on immune-mediated kidney diseases, with a strong focus on T cell biology. My investigations into the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine’s efficacy in immunosuppressed patients bridged the lab and the clinic, poised to directly inform patient care. This experience has transformed my commitment to medicine, desiring not only to be a practitioner of medicine as a physician but a contributor to medicine as a scientist.

Efficacy of SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Immuno: Processed blood samples and isolated PBMCs for immunological testing
Performed ELISpot assays and flow cytometry analyses
Conducted advanced data analysis using statistical and machine learning methods
Authored and defended my undergraduate honors thesis on this project
Identifying and Characterizing CD8+ Treg: Conducted a literature review and feasibility assessment
Proposed an experimental design and budget
CD4+ Treg Functionality Assays: Isolated Tregs in a GCP-compliant facility
Managed and maintained Treg cell cultures
Murine Model Experiments: Extracted splenocytes from whole mouse spleens
Reconstituted suspensions for reintroduction into mouse models
Collaborative and Supportive Roles on Ot: Performed PCR, ELISAs, gel electrophoresis, and various blots
Processed stool samples for microbiome study and blood samples for various ANCA-related studies

projects.title: Science Communication and Education
projects.description: I began to realize early into my college career how unnecessarily complicated science topics were often made and, as public trust in the scientific community declined during the pandemic, I was driven to make scientific knowledge more accessible. This conviction led me to pursue both scientific writing and instruction as powerful tools to make this knowledge clear, engaging, and impactful.

Learning Assistant for UNC’s BIOL 252L: Co-instructed three semesters of Human Anatomy and Physiology Laboratory alongside a TA
Led interactive 1-on-1 as well as group lab sessions
Covered breakthrough research in accessible, engaging formats
Designed review materials and practice questions to support student mastery of complex systems
Writer and Editor for the Carolina Scien: Wrote three in-depth articles covering biomedical breakthroughs and public health topics
Interviewed researchers and translated complex studies into reader-friendly content
Edited collaboratively to meet journalistic standards and scientific accuracy
Focused on accessibility, narrative voice, and engaging headlines
Teaching Assistant in Introductory Biolo: Provided detailed, constructive feedback on assignments to support content mastery
Edited student papers for clarity, organization, and scientific accuracy
Offered academic support and encouragement to individuals in the work-release program

projects.title: Direct Patient Care
projects.description: Patients are the reason I chose to pursue medicine, and my role on 6 Children’s gave me my first experience with direct responsibility for their care. As a combined Nursing Assistant and Healthcare Unit Clerk in a 24-bed intermediate unit, I supported children on Neurology, Pulmonary, GI, Endocrine, and General Pediatric services. Balancing clinical duties with administrative coordination and care team communication with patient and family support, I learned to be both a caregiver and a team communicator strengthening my commitment to patient-centered medicine.

Neurology Service: Eating disorders such as anorexia, bulimia, ARFID, and PICA
Psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, major depressive disorder, anxiety disorders, OCD
Pulmonary Service: Respiratory viruses such as RSV, SARS-CoV-2, parvovirus, etc.
GI Service: Gastrointestinal infections such as salmonella, C. difficile, norovirus, etc.
Other Services: Hematologic malignancies such as sickle cell crises, thromboses, and hemophilia
End-stage renal disease, chronic kidney disease, and individuals on dialysis
Various autoimmune conditions including lupus and vasculitis

projects.title: Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI
projects.description: My interest in AI/ML was sparked during the generative AI boom of late 2022, when OpenAI rolled out GPT-3.5 to the public in the form of ChatGPT, reshaping how we think about knowledge and automation. Soon after, I immersed myself in the field and, as an intern at Syneos Health, built the prototype of an AI-augmented clinical trial protocol generator. The project gained recognition for its innovation, ultimately being featured in Wired.

projects.title: Application Development
projects.description: I built my first app as a junior in high school for a computer science elective in Swift modeling the "pong" game on GamePigeon. Eight years later, I have developed well over a dozen applications in half-a-dozen different languages. From an iOS expiration date tracker to an automated secret Santa algorithm, the freedom of imagination and the zero-cost to produce has made programming not just a hobby but a means of personal creation.

projects.title: Public Health, Health Access, and Health Equity
projects.description: Wednesday nights from 6PM until 12AM, I would assist individuals in my community receive health insurance and health coverage at a clinic down the road from my university. Beyond clinic hours, I often fielded calls from patients throughout the week, guiding them in transitioning to long-term, stable care solutions. This role sat at the intersection of the social and medical, revealing to me the complexities of the US healthcare system and empowering me to leverage my understanding to assist others.

Frameworks Navigated: Basics of NC and US Citizenship and Residency
Interests in Public Health: Social determinants of health and their impact on patient outcomes
Epidemiology of both infectious and chronic diseases
Delivering care in under-resourced medical settings
Streamlining patient navigation through complex healthcare systems
Health policy development and advocacy for equitable access
Integrating public health principles into clinical medicine
Closing gaps and reducing inequities in the healthcare system
Increasing global access to modern medicine
Integrating traditional and Eastern medicine into modern medical practice

projects.title: Community Service
projects.description: My father is an Eagle Scout meaning I grew up with the Sir Robert Baden-Powell quote "try to leave this world a little better than you found it." While many of my father’s sayings made me laugh (or roll my eyes), this one has shaped how I live my life. For more than a decade, I’ve committed myself to volunteering in different capacities, making service not just an activity but a core part of how I spend my free time and contribute to my community.

Volunteer Track Record: Special Olympics — Supported young athletes, fostering inclusion and empowerment through sport across fall, winter, and spring seasons
UNC Pediatric Playroom — Engaged young patients in play-based learning and activities to ease hospital stays
TABLE — Helped provide healthy meals to families facing food insecurity in the Chapel Hill community
K4C Soccer Club — Mentored youth athletes, teaching teamwork, sportsmanship, and resilience
Habitat for Humanity — Contributed to home-building projects to promote affordable housing
Skills Learned & Impact Made: Ethical service through participation and active listening
Leadership and collaboration within service teams
Time management while balancing service with academics/professional responsibilities

projects.title: Entrepreneurship
projects.description: I helped my father build and launch Six Components, a consulting firm that enables healthcare solution companies to leverage big data, implement AI, and become digital-first enterprises. I contributed to the brand identity, designed the website, and co-created our client outreach strategy. With no roadmap and a constantly evolving set of challenges, I learned by doing — adapting quickly, solving problems creatively, and thinking strategically. This hands-on experience in fast-paced, solution-driven work inspired me to pursue my own entrepreneurial ventures, which I am now developing to transform how medicine meets a changing world.

Responsibilities and Experience: Co-created the company’s brand identity including logo design, color palette, and typography guidelines
Standardized branding guidelines for consistent use across all digital and print channels
Built a responsive, SEO-optimized website and designed a cohesive digital user experience
Established internal workflows and automations to streamline operations and improve efficiency
Implemented internal digital security and web presence
Oversaw administrative and logistical setup for company operations including company email systems, domain registration, cloud storage, and other administrative infrastructure
Drafted internal documentation for repeatable processes, best practices, and operational protocols
Developed a company content-creation workflow to increase public engagement and reach
